content: On September 22, 1982, the Atlanta Braves clinched the National League West title, marking their first division championship since the franchise moved to Atlanta. The Braves secured their postseason berth with a 5-4 victory over the San Francisco Giants at Atlanta-Fulton County Stadium. This win was highlighted by a clutch performance from Bob Horner, who hit a crucial home run, helping the team finish the season with a remarkable turnaround after struggling in previous years.
